titleStmt.title: Philip A. Hoyne to James W. Tate
CWG2677

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
PHILIP A. HOYNE,
NOTARY
And Commissioner of Deeds
FOR ALL THE
States and Territories of the U.S.

United States Commissioner's Office,
Chicago, February 11th 1862.
Yours of the 6th came to hand this morning. Enclosed please find $5 -- fees as requested by Statute, previous to issuing my Commission
Please forward commission immediately to date from the expiration of the old one

yours very Respy
P A Hoyne
